laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Complete Blood Count and Iron Studies
laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal counts. Hemoglobin: 11.0 g/dl (normal range 12.0–16.0), Hematocrit: 36.2% (normal range 36.0–46.0), White cell count: 7030 per mm3 (normal range 4500–11,000), Platelet count: 247,000 per mm3 (normal range 150,000–400,000).
Clear, yellow urine, specific gravity: 1.008, pH: 7.0, 1+ occult blood, 3+ albumin, 5–10 red cells and 0–2 white cells per high-power field.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Remained near the patient's baseline level.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 1.0 g of albumin per gram of creatinine.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased to 5.3 g of albumin per gram of creatinine at the current evaluation.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 6.6 g (determined with urine total protein:creatinine ratio), urine albumin level was significantly elevated.
Positive for circulating antibodies to PLA2R, quantified at 55.6 RU per milliliter (positive value >20).
